page.title: 15LANDSCAPE KIRKBY MALZEARD
page.content: The landscape is rural,with 2 villages and small farms.It is uneven in height and varies from 230m in West to 135m in East. The fields are small and enclosed by{mixed hedges}or{stone walls,with many mature trees and small woods.The houses and farms are almost entirely built of{local stone,}with slate, stone, or{Yorkshire tile}roofs, often with gardens. Each village has a mix of old & new dwellings.{Mowbray {Hall}in Kirkby Malzeard is a fine large house.The church dates from 12th cent.and that of Grewelthorpe & the Chapels are over 100yrs old. The stone {Butter Cross}dates from 1307AD. Each village has a church & chapel, a wide main street, a green, and Grewelthorpe has a pond. The metalled roads are narrow. There are many unpaved tracks and designated footpaths.
